snippet: Kansas will not issue any report cards this year on how its public school students performed on standardized reading and math tests after cyberattacks and other problems this spring, the State Board of Education decided Tuesday.
abstract: Kansas State Board of Education announces that state will not issue any report cards for 2014 on how its public school students performed on standardized reading and math tests after series of cyberattacks; federal Education Department must sign off on decision.
lead_paragraph: Kansas will not issue any report cards this year on how its public school students performed on standardized reading and math tests after cyberattacks and other problems this spring, the State Board of Education decided Tuesday.

headline.main: Kansas: Data From School Tests Will Not Be Released
headline.print_headline: Kansas: Data From School Tests Will Not Be Released
